text:
I don't use Tomcat myself, but I connected to the Tomcat server on a friend's
computer, running the numberguess JSP example.  I replaced the p in .jsp with
%70, which is hex for 'p'.  As far as I could see, I got the source code
of the script.

If I'm correct, this is a major security problem.

I do not provide the URL, as I do not know if my friend wants lots of
traffic. :)
creator: shh@thathost.com

text:
Problem was due to incorrect URL decoding of the request URI.  It is fixed
in tonight's nightly build, and in Tomcat 4.0 beta 2.
creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com

text:
You should remove URL decoding from lower level handlers.  After your fix,
it is possible to write numguess.js%2570 to get the source code.
creator: shh@thathost.com
